answers.answer: What you don't mention is how long you have been diabetic and how well controlled your blood sugar is. Complications such as neuropathy are caused by long periods of time spent at high blood sugars. The most important thing you can do to minimize complications is to lower your blood sugars. I know lack of insurance is a problem, but you should test and alter your intake of carbs as necessary to lower blood sugars as well as lose weight if you are overweight.No, I wouldn't get married just to use your girlfriend's insurance. Marriage is something you do after much thought because you want to be married to that person.  If you continue to have problems or if you are unable to control blood sugar and need a change of meds or insulin, I would go to the free clinic.

question: I am worried I might have Diabetic Neuropathy.  I am unemployed and I can only afford a free clinic.  I take meds for my Diabetes 2.  I was feeling fine, until i started developing tingling and burning sensations in my legs and feet.  My feet hurt, especially when I walk.  Shoes hurt my feet.  It's hard for me to sleep under covers, because it bothers me legs and feet. Note that the only real excercise i do is walk 3 times a day.  but even that is strting to take its toll.  How serious can this be and will I be able to afford the treatment at a free clinic?  i do have one option.  I could marry my longtime girlfriend and use her insurance.  would that be wise?  i don't want my complications to get more serious without treatment.
title: Do I have Diabetic Neuropathy?
